item.title: DistilBERT, a distilled version of BERT: smaller, faster, cheaper and lighter (2019)
item.description: DistilBERT is a method to pre-train a smaller BERT with knowledge distillation. The training loss of DistilBERT is a linear combination of the masked-language modeling loss, cross-entropy loss between the DistilBERT model and the BERT model, a cosine similarity between the hidden states of both models. During pre-training, DistilBERT uses a softmax-temperature. While at inference, the temperature is set to \(1\). The token-type embeddings and the pooler are removed while the number of layers is reduced by a factor of two.
